data.title: Only one window reopens when opening VSCode
data.body:
When you have more than one window open and you quit reopen VSCode only one window reopens.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|erb|CraigMaslowski|0.0.1|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.3|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.10|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.3.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open multiple projects so you have multiple windows open.
2. Quit VSCode
3. Reopen VSCode.

data.title: Dragged selections can only be dropped 1 character away from their origin
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a selection
2. Attempt to drag and drop that selection beside itself (to essentially duplicate it, same as CTRL+C, CTRL+V)

GIF demoing workflow:

![drag and drop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/441982/24932069/e8adc014-1edd-11e7-9caa-07817c4dcb05.gif)

data.title: Less-than (<) and greater-than (>) symbols escaped to < and > in find output
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-Insider
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ctrl-Shift-F to open find-all
2. Search for `<` or `>`.
3. In the results below, it is escaped to `<` or `>`.

This does *not* happen in VSCode 1.11.1.

data.title: Fix - #24242
data.body: Extension count and ratings should be displayed irrespective of shrinking or expansion of extension explorer.Considering this fixed the `width` of `header` to `80%`

data.title: Receive warning about path when opening code
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
1.11.1

- OS Version:
Windows 10 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code.
2. Wait a few seconds.
3. (Screenshot attached) Warning message appears: "Warn the path C:\Users\<user name>\AppData\Roaming"

Doesn't appear to be a full warning message. There's no indication to what the actual issue might be. Googling this issue and searching on Stack Overflow yielded no results

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2152093/24928816/63e30042-1ec9-11e7-8acc-1b217adf12f7.png)

data.title: Move TS Feature API Gating Into Providers Themselves
data.body:
**Bug**
Currently, some TS features are registered on activate only if the TSServer version meet a certain set of requirements.  Now that the TypeScript service can be restarted, this may cause features to be incorrectly enabled / disabled if the TypeScript version changes

data.title: Cursor (with copy indication) only changes on mouse move
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select text in an editor tab
2. Click and drag text, but don't drop it
3. Hold the mouse still
4. Press and release the CTRL key a lot -- the cursor should change.

In VS 20xx, while dragging text you can press and release CTRL to affect the mouse cursor.  My typical workflow is, 1) select text, 2) drag text, 3) hold control, 4) drop text. With this workflow, since my mouse is still, it's not clear that the text will be copied when I release the mouse.

CC: @rebornix

data.title: Cannot click process picker in compound mode
data.body:
Re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/22279

When we try to debug both the client and server code of mean stack, we set up a compound launch task.

For server side code, we use `"processId": "${command.PickProcess}",` to help find the process. Once we hit F5, we see the Process Picker and before we choose the process, the debugger instance for client code launches and Process Picker dismisses.

data.title: CSS formatting
data.body:
Hello,

What are you thinking about CSS formatting? VS Code right now format HTML, JS, TS, JSON, but what about CSS? Any future plans to add CSS formatting? I know we have plugin for that, but it will be cool to have built-in CSS formatting.

data.title: auto-select on workbench.action.openNextRecentlyUsedEditorInGroup
data.body:
Is it possible to send an argument or make a setting so that using the named function always selects the first match without confirm?

I want to rebind to another key than Ctrl-tab (leader + key in VSCodeVim to be specific), and when I do it seems that I have to confirm the switch with Enter whenever I use it.

data.title: Feature: The ability to provide a workspace relative path to Recommended Workspace Extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Our team has private extensions that are designed to work in our particular workspace (build commands, testing, etc.). The extensions are checked into source control in the workspace, not published to the store. It would be nice if I could get these to show up in Recommended Workspace Extensions. Seems simple enough to detect if the extension name is a workspace relative path to a vsix file.

data.title: How to format the JSON file through API and save it.
data.body:
Is there a code api that takes File path and format to its language like `json` and then save it or return the format text so we can save that file after formatting ?
The vscode should check if its possible through any extension or itself, it should do it.

data.title: How to insert the setting key for arrays and object through API
data.body:
Hello,

Following are the two cases:
```json
"[go]": {
        "editor.insertSpaces": false,
         "diffEditor.renderIndicators": true
    },
"vscode_custom_css.imports": [
    "file:///C:/Users/WorkUsername/.vscode/ui-theme.css"
]
```
How i can **get** and  **add** the key `editor.insertSpaces` In [GO] Section and add new text in array for `"vscode_custom_css.imports`

Following is the current code.
```json
let config = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration();
config.update("editor.insertSpaces", "value", true)
```

data.title: Save All Files messes up my code formatting badly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1 - OS Version: mac OS Sierra 10.12 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Work on a few files, like html, scss, ts 2. On any file try to hit option + cmd + s or hit save all button from sidebar, it messes up my code in the current file really badly. I'm really annoyed with this bug, it gets pushed to github and causes a lot of conflicts For eg: My file after save looks like this ```
{ { labelText } }
{ { getChipValue(chip) } } close
  • { { config ? suggestion.get(config.text): suggestion } }
``` Same thing happens with my ts files a lot which causes errors due to this hard formatting.

data.title: Pass implied type to TypeScript language service
data.body:
Test tour #23385

Not necessarily something we need to do, but maybe you know how to do this:

.vue files have a script part that assigns a particular type to module.exports. There should be a way to tell the TypeScript language service about that.

Relevant source: https://github.com/octref/vetur/blob/master/server/src/modes/javascriptMode.ts

data.title: vscode update to 1.11 removes mostly all default keybindings
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Fedora 25 x86_64, XFCE desktop, LANG=ru_RU.UTF-8

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install 1.11 or update from 1.10 to 1.11
2. press Ctrl+N, Ctrl+S - no result, also drop-down menu shows no keybindings for frequently used (i'd say - standart)  actions.

[layout.ru_pc105.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/913929/layout.ru_pc105.txt)

update: vscode on Ubuntu-14 x86_64 LANG=ru_RU.UTF-8 isn't affected by this issue

data.title: Remove sort order context menu
data.body:
Why would anyone want to sort in ascending order. Remove this two items from the context menu to simplify it.
Do we have telemetry for these actions so I can prove my thinking that nobody is clicking on these actions

![screen shot 2017-04-11 at 18 02 08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/24918529/049f1f54-1ee1-11e7-9696-90e21ff4c49c.png)

data.title: QuickOpen should prefer matches with fewer splits of search terms
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create  abc\s1\s2\file.txt 
2. create a\bc\file.txt
3. Ctrl + P - quickopen - and type "abc f"

I'd expect the results to prefer the match (abc\s1\s2\file.txt) which does not split "abc" into "a bc"

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open command palette
2.Observe Actions

data.title: Hide unwanted files in explorer
data.body:
I'm working on a Django project with vscode-1.10.2.
Just a tiny problem,there're a lot of .pyc files generated everytime I run the server,the explorer in vscode always looks like this:
![0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14197779/24916737/93b15a50-1f0d-11e7-9ca1-fd8979ab11c0.JPG)
The generated file just looks so similar, and I have to choose and click the origins very careful
It would be really nice having settings(filter) to hide unwanted files with specific filename extensions

data.title: Terminal no longer changing to project directory
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a directory in vscode
2. Open the embedded terminal

The embedded terminal used to change the cwd to the directory of my project, but now it's as if I opened a normal terminal window (cwd is my default starting cwd). Could this be caused by the `cd` command in my `.bash_profile`?

data.title: English International keyboard: ` and § keys are swapped in keyboard shortcuts on macOS
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.2| |vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13| |path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0| |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8| |python|donjayamanne|0.6.0| |theme-dracula|dracula-theme|1.9.1| |tslint|eg2|0.11.0| |theme-a|esz|1.1.7| |file-icons|file-icons|1.0.3| |flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.5.0| |language-julia|julialang|0.5.1| |types-autoinstaller|jvitor83|2.1.2| |vscode-rust|kalitaalexey|0.3.11| |Go|lukehoban|0.6.59| |atom-keybindings|ms-vscode|2.0.1| |debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3| |ide-purescript|nwolverson|0.8.1| |language-purescript|nwolverson|0.1.1| |theme-quietlight-vsc|onecrayon|1.0.2| |final-newline|samverschueren|0.3.2| |vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2| |join-lines|wmaurer|0.2.2|; --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Buy Apple Computer with “English International” keyboard ([look for “International” here](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201794)) 2. Configure macOS to use the “ABC Extended” Layout. Screenshot: 3. Open VSCode 4. Notice that the \` and § keys work as intended 5. Notice that the ⌃\` (Toggle Integrated Terminal) and ⌃⇧\` (Create New Integrated Terminal) keyboard shortcuts don’t work 6. Open the “Keyboard Shortcuts” Settings (⌘K ⌘S) 7. Configure “Toggle Integrated Terminal” to use the ⌃\` shortcut (which the page says it already uses!) 8. Notice that the page now says that “Toggle Integrated Terminal” uses ⌃§(!) 9. Notice that ⌃\` **does** in fact run “Toggle Integrated Terminal” 10. Notice that, apart from keyboard shortcuts, \` and § still work as intended This is very likely to be related to the keybinding changes in 1.11. It still seems like a bug. The other commands mentioned in the release notes work fine.

data.title: My file wrongly autodetected as Javascript instead of Javascript React
data.body:
Refs: #24403

1. npm install -g create-react-app
2. create-react-app my-app
3. cd my-app/
4. code-insiders .

Notice all react files as detected as javascript files. I would expect they are auto detected as javascript react files.
